ETYMOLOGY: From Old Norse ǫxull, from Proto-Germanic *ahsō (compare Old English eax, Old High German ahsa), from Proto-Indo-European *h₂eḱs- (compare Latin axis 'axle', Greek áxōn 'axle').

MEANINGS.PATTERN: [sth] has an axle | the axle of [sth]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A rod or spindle (either fixed or rotating) passing through the center of a wheel or group of wheels, supporting a vehicle or structure.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （车辆或机械的）轴；车轴；心轴。穿过一个或一组车轮中心的杆或心轴，可固定或转动，支撑车辆或结构。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The car's front axle needed to be replaced after the accident.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 事故发生后，汽车的前轴需要更换。

REGISTER: Commonly used in everyday language when referring to vehicles, and more technically in engineering and mechanics.
